verses.verse: Then the LORD (2 Pet. 2:16) opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
And Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have abused me. I wish there were a sword in my hand, ((Prov. 12:10; Matt. 15:19)) for now I would kill you!”
(2 Pet. 2:16) So the donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey on which you have ridden, ever since I became yours, to this day? Was I ever disposed to do this to you?” And he said, “No.”

Then the LORD (Gen. 21:19; 2 Kin. 6:17; Luke 24:16, 31) opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the Angel of the LORD standing in the way with His drawn sword in His hand; and he bowed his head and fell flat on his face.
And the Angel of the LORD said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out to stand against you, because your way is ((2 Pet. 2:14, 15)) perverse before Me.
The donkey saw Me and turned aside from Me these three times. If she had not turned aside from Me, surely I would also have killed you by now, and let her live.”

And Balaam said to the Angel of the LORD, (1 Sam. 15:24, 30; 26:21; 2 Sam. 12:13) “I have sinned, for I did not know You stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases You, I will turn back.”
Then the Angel of the LORD said to Balaam, “Go with the men, (Num. 22:20) but only the word that I speak to you, that you shall speak.” So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
Now when Balak heard that Balaam was coming, (Gen. 14:17) he went out to meet him at the city of Moab, (Num. 21:13) which is on the border at the Arnon, the boundary of the territory.
Then Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not earnestly send to you, calling for you? Why did you not come to me? Am I not able (Num. 22:17; 24:11) to honor you?”

And Balaam said to Balak, “Look, I have come to you! Now, have I any power at all to say anything? (Num. 23:26; 24:13; 1 Kin. 22:14; 2 Chr. 18:13) The word that God puts in my mouth, that I must speak.”
So Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kirjath Huzoth.
Then Balak offered oxen and sheep, and he sent some to Balaam and to the princes who were with him.

(Balaam’s First Prophecy) So it was, the next day, that Balak took Balaam and brought him up to the (Num. 21:28; Deut. 12:2) high places of Baal, that from there he might observe the extent of the people.
Then Balaam said to Balak, (Num. 23:29) “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
And Balak did just as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam (Num. 23:14, 30) offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

Then Balaam said to Balak, (Num. 23:15) “Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps the LORD will come (Num. 23:4, 16) to meet me, and whatever He shows me I will tell you.” So he went to a desolate height.
(Num. 23:16) And God met Balaam, and he said to Him, “I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered on each altar a bull and a ram.”
Then the LORD (Num. 22:20, 35, 38; 23:16; Deut. 18:18; Jer. 1:9) put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
So he returned to him, and there he was, standing by his burnt offering, he and all the princes of Moab.

And he (Deut. 23:4; Job 27:1; 29:1; Ps. 78:2) took up his oracle and said: “Balak the king of Moab has brought me from Aram, From the mountains of the east. (Num. 22:6, 11, 17) ‘Come, curse Jacob for me, And come, (1 Sam. 17:10) denounce Israel!’
“How (Num. 22:12) shall I curse whom God has not cursed? And how shall I denounce whom the LORD has not denounced?

For from the top of the rocks I see him, And from the hills I behold him; There! (Deut. 32:8; 33:28; Josh. 11:23) A people dwelling alone, (Ex. 33:16; Ezra 9:2; (Eph. 2:14)) Not reckoning itself among the nations.
“Who (Gen. 13:16; 22:17; 28:14; 2 Chr. 1:9) can count the dust of Jacob, Or number one-fourth of Israel? Let me die (Ps. 116:15) the death of the righteous, And let my end be like his!”
Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? (Num. 22:11) I took you to curse my enemies, and look, you have blessed them bountifully!”
So he answered and said, (Num. 22:38) “Must I not take heed to speak what the LORD has put in my mouth?”

(Balaam’s Second Prophecy) Then Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place from which you may see them; you shall see only the outer part of them, and shall not see them all; curse them for me from there.”
So he brought him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, (Num. 23:1, 2) and built seven altars, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
And he said to Balak, “Stand here by your burnt offering while I meet the LORD over there.”
Then the LORD met Balaam, and (Num. 22:35; 23:5) put a word in his mouth, and said, “Go back to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
